body:
*Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.

When creating a spack environment if I have an externally defined root such as cmake, it does not show up in the view that is subsequently created.  While it can be created in multiple ways, I encountered this with the PR https://github.com/LLNL/lbann/pull/1414.

Note that @becker33 I gave you a spack.yaml file that has this problem.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack create env lbann-dev spack.yaml
$ spack activate -p lbann-dev
$ which cmake
...
```

### Error Message

The output of 

```console
$ which cmake
```

points to the system cmake, not the externally defined cmake.

### Information on your system

This includes:

 1. LLNL LC Pascal
 2. spack.yaml file given to @becker33 

-----

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack!
title: externally defined roots are not defined in environments
